                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Andrew Porter Biddle papers, 1923-1944</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Contain a memorial resolution adopted by the Detroit Board of Education August 9, 1923, upon the death of Beatrice B. Biddle; resolution in memory of Andrew P. Biddle, adopted by the Wayne County Medical Society, August 4, 1944; scrapbook containing manuscripts and pamphlets about Biddle. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Detroit Public Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:539401180</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-BEU</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Patrick, Lawrence C.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Lawrence C. Patrick, Jr. papers, 1987-2009.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Files relating to his involvement in Group of Organized Detroiters for Quality Education (GOOD), 1987-1989, his campaign to the Detroit Board of Education in 1988, his efforts to implement reforms and school empowerment through local control of budget, personnel, curriculum, etc.; also speeches, clippings, and collected reports and studies relating to issues within the Detroit Public School system. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Michigan</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Lawrence C. Patrick, Jr. papers, 1987-2009.
resource.abstract: Files relating to his involvement in Group of Organized Detroiters for Quality Education (GOOD), 1987-1989, his campaign to the Detroit Board of Education in 1988, his efforts to implement reforms and school empowerment through local control of budget, personnel, curriculum, etc.; also speeches, clippings, and collected reports and studies relating to issues within the Detroit Public School system.
resource.displayEntry: Patrick, Lawrence C. Lawrence C. Patrick, Jr. papers, 1987-2009.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:670080094</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EYP</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Shattuck, Marquis E., 1888-1971.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Williams, G. Mennen, 1911-1988.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Marquis E. Shattuck papers, 1868-1984.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>This collection contains papers of Mr. Shattuck's organizational affiliations, his many years with the Detroit Public Schools, and with his genealogy and historical interests. Of particular note is an autographed letter from Michigan Governor G. Mennen Williams (Box 45:2). The oldest items in the collection may be found with Detroit Public Schools Historical Materials, 1868-1882 (Box 35:8 and 10) and SAR applications which date back to 1894 (Box 5:7) and year books, dating from 1890 (Box 11:3). </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Detroit Public Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Marquis E. Shattuck papers, 1868-1984.
resource.abstract: This collection contains papers of Mr. Shattuck's organizational affiliations, his many years with the Detroit Public Schools, and with his genealogy and historical interests. Of particular note is an autographed letter from Michigan Governor G. Mennen Williams (Box 45:2). The oldest items in the collection may be found with Detroit Public Schools Historical Materials, 1868-1882 (Box 35:8 and 10) and SAR applications which date back to 1894 (Box 5:7) and year books, dating from 1890 (Box 11:3).
resource.extent: 23 linear ft. (45 boxes, 4 volumes, 1 large manuscript)
resource.displayEntry: Shattuck, Marquis E., 1888-1971. Marquis E. Shattuck papers, 1868-1984.

                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EMQ</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Goodman, Ernest, 1906-</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Wayne State University. Archives of Labor and Urban Affairs.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Ernest Goodman papers, 1952-1977, (bulk 1952-1972).</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Trial records, research material, published materials, leaflets, newsclippings, newsletters, pamphlets and correspondence reflecting Mr. Goodman's activities as counsel during three of his most important cases concerning civil rights and constitutional law: The Michigan Smith Act trial, the Sherrill School desegregation case, and the Black Panther trial. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Wayne State University, Archives of Labor & Urban</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Ernest Goodman papers, 1952-1977, (bulk 1952-1972).
resource.abstract: Trial records, research material, published materials, leaflets, newsclippings, newsletters, pamphlets and correspondence reflecting Mr. Goodman's activities as counsel during three of his most important cases concerning civil rights and constitutional law: The Michigan Smith Act trial, the Sherrill School desegregation case, and the Black Panther trial.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:57467266</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EYP</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Detroit (Mich.). Board of Education.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Records of the Detroit Board of Education, 1955-1978 (bulk 1970-1978).</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>The bulk of the collection consists of material from the Central board including meeting minutes and agendas, committee reports (Finance, Personnel, Housing, School-Community Relations, Curriculum, Legislative, Desegregation), reports of related community organizations, plans for desegregation and decentralization, including court orders, material on student testing, special programs, employee relations, enrollment, etc. and board publications such as: Communicator (1974-1977); Directline (1979-1981); Facts about Detroit schools (1971-1974); Pipeline (1971-1978, 1980); Reporter (1974-1978), Principal's notes (Nov. 1973-May 1976); Schools in the news (1975-1977). Material from the regional boards covers some of the same topics as the Central board, along with correspondence and minutes from Regions 5, 6 and 7. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Detroit Public Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Records of the Detroit Board of Education, 1955-1978 (bulk 1970-1978).
resource.abstract: The bulk of the collection consists of material from the Central board including meeting minutes and agendas, committee reports (Finance, Personnel, Housing, School-Community Relations, Curriculum, Legislative, Desegregation), reports of related community organizations, plans for desegregation and decentralization, including court orders, material on student testing, special programs, employee relations, enrollment, etc. and board publications such as: Communicator (1974-1977); Directline (1979-1981); Facts about Detroit schools (1971-1974); Pipeline (1971-1978, 1980); Reporter (1974-1978), Principal's notes (Nov. 1973-May 1976); Schools in the news (1975-1977). Material from the regional boards covers some of the same topics as the Central board, along with correspondence and minutes from Regions 5, 6 and 7.
resource.displayEntry: Detroit (Mich.). Board of Education. Records of the Detroit Board of Education, 1955-1978 (bulk 1970-1978).

                     <namePart>Del Rio, James.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>James Del Rio collection.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>This collection consists of various legislative materials, dating from 1971-1972, of Rep. James Del Rio. The collection includes information files on the following: abortion, education, bussing, Detroit School Board, civil rights, criminal code, drugs, elections, Highway Dept., housing, Wayne County Community College, Lou Gordon interview, unfinished work, and miscellaneous bills. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>State Archive of Michigan</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: James Del Rio collection.

The collection includes information files on the following: abortion, education, bussing, Detroit School Board, civil rights, criminal code, drugs, elections, Highway Dept., housing, Wayne County Community College, Lou Gordon interview, unfinished work, and miscellaneous bills.
resource.displayEntry: Del Rio, James. James Del Rio collection.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:38561982</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EHL</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Roth, Stephen T., 1908-1974.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Papers, 1936,1979.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Papers of Judge Roth, 1936, 1944-1979 and undated include: biographical materials; photocopies of court transcripts, correspondence, and newspaper clippings regarding the Circuit Court of Appeals (of Michigan); notes and correspondence about elections and court reform; correspondence of the Criminal Investigation Division (World War II); Flint Hungarian Relief Committee correspondence and newspaper clippings; correspondence and minutes of the Michigan Judges Association-Court Administration Committee; newspaper clippings and news releases about his life and court cases; personal correspondence, newspaper clippings, and photographs; correspondence from the Sixth Judicial Circuit Court (of Michigan) with Justice Warren Burger; Roth's speeches, many about Michigan judges and legal issues; various certificates of Roth's appointment to the Seventh Judicial Circuit Court and election. The collection suffers from some mold and mildew problems and should be used with care by researchers. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Clarke Historical Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Papers, 1936,1979.
resource.abstract: Papers of Judge Roth, 1936, 1944-1979 and undated include: biographical materials; photocopies of court transcripts, correspondence, and newspaper clippings regarding the Circuit Court of Appeals (of Michigan); notes and correspondence about elections and court reform; correspondence of the Criminal Investigation Division (World War II); Flint Hungarian Relief Committee correspondence and newspaper clippings; correspondence and minutes of the Michigan Judges Association-Court Administration Committee; newspaper clippings and news releases about his life and court cases; personal correspondence, newspaper clippings, and photographs; correspondence from the Sixth Judicial Circuit Court (of Michigan) with Justice Warren Burger; Roth's speeches, many about Michigan judges and legal issues; various certificates of Roth's appointment to the Seventh Judicial Circuit Court and election. The collection suffers from some mold and mildew problems and should be used with care by researchers.
resource.extent: ca. 2 cubic ft. (in 2 boxes and 1 oversized folder) : ill.

                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Oral history interview with Snow F. Grigsby, 1967.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>From 1968-1970, Herbert Hill, Roberta McBride and Norman McRae conducted oral history interviews with 32 African-Americans who played a role in trade-unionism in the United States. Major subjects covered were: Afro-American employment, civil rights organizations, trade-unions and organizing, UAW black caucus, discrimination, race relations, segregation, strikes and lockouts, and wages. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Wayne State University, Archives of Labor & Urban</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
